intro: Syzygiopsis, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that resemble small cups, hence its common name. Syzygiopsis typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
